summary: Email correspondence between Gloria Allred and an Assistant United States Attorney regarding an upcoming court conference scheduled by Judge Berman to discuss dismissal of the indictment against Jeffrey Epstein following his death. The email discusses arrangements for victims to attend and be heard at the conference.

keyFacts: Judge Berman scheduled a conference for August 27, 2019 to discuss dismissing the indictment against Jeffrey Epstein following his death.
The court order indicated victims would be allowed to be heard during the proceeding, either directly or through counsel.
Prosecutors offered to assist with travel costs for victims who wanted to attend the conference but couldn't afford it.
The email shows coordination between victim attorneys and prosecutors regarding victim participation in post-death legal proceedings.
